data.title: David Gant Obituary - Wall, New Jersey
data.meta_description: David A. Gant Sr., 65 of Wall Township passed away Saturday, April 3, 2010 at his home surrounded by his loving family.  Born in Point Pleasant, NJ he had lived in Brick before moving to Wall thirty five years ago. He had a vacation home on the Outer Banks of North Carolina (Avon) which he enjoyed traveling to with his wife, children and grandchildren. He was an avid golfer and loved the beach.  He was a 1974 graduate of Rutgers University, and then went on to work as a Farm Supervisor at the Rutgers University Research Farm for 38 years before retiring in 2000.  He was a member of the Pierce Memorial Church, Farmingdale, NJ.  He is survived by his devoted wife of 44 years Constance A. Hanson Gant, his children and their spouses; David A. Jr. and wife Karen of South River, Wayne and wife Denise of Keyport, and Darlene and Joe Panzera of Belfair, Wa., his brother Paul Gant and wife Lynn of Delta, Pa., his sister Claire Schaaf and husband Raymond of Avon, N.C., and his 5 grandchildren Samantha, Robert, Jason, Katelyn, and Brianna.  Relatives and friends are invited to call today from 7-9pm and on Wednesday from  10:30am until the time of the Funeral Service at 11:00am at the Oâ€™Brien Funeral Home, 2028 Hwy 35 at New Bedford Rd., Wall. Burial will be in Evergreen Cemetery, Farmingdale.  In lieu of flowers the family requests donations to the American Cancer Society, 801 Broad St., Shrewsbury, NJ 07702.
